meanings.sent1: The orchestra played a beautiful reprise of the melody.
meanings.sent2: The singer ended the song with a reprise of the chorus.
meanings.sent3: During the concert, the reprise of the tune made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The reprise of the piano notes echoed through the hall.
meanings.sent5: The reprise of the violin solo was hauntingly beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The actor's reprise of the role was well-received by the audience.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's reprise of the joke had everyone laughing again.
meanings.sent3: The reprise of the magic trick left the children in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her reprise of the dance routine was flawless.
meanings.sent5: The reprise of the play brought back fond memories for the cast.

meanings.definition: To repeat or resume an action or performance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reprise her role in the school play.
meanings.sent2: The band will reprise their hit song at the concert.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would reprise his failed attempt at cooking.
meanings.sent4: The team plans to reprise their championship win next season.
meanings.sent5: The actor will reprise his famous character in the sequel.
